comments.article:
Why do you like the skull smasing, incestous pedophiles in this series I wonder? Could it be because you like to see the bad guys get their heads bashed in?

Well what about in real life? George Bush has protected our country so well...not a single terrorist attack in seven years. Why can't you say he has done a good job?

Is it soooo cool to bash the defenders of America? Or do you believe that America had it coming?

What about Obama do you like? That he will steal the money from the people who have invested their time and money to become wealthy?

That he will force businesses to pay for health care when no where in the constitution is such a measure implied (yes I have read it...many times)

That he will support promiscuity through abortion?

That he will let our country be over run by illegal aliens?

Sure it is easy to say he will fix things...too easy to say. How about the things he will break, and break things he will.

America is free through proactive defense of our country
America is prosperous through capitalism
America is inclusive not because of focusing on race, but because of ignoring race.

comments.subject: Created a profile just to reply to this ignorance

comments.article:
Tonight, I am proud.

A great day indeed, may many more follow it.
It hasn't sunk in yet. We created history.
We're LIVING this history!  Yee-haw!
Congratulations, America. I'm from the Philippines but this election profoundly affects us (and the entire world) in so many ways. We're celebrating with you.

This is a Patronus memory.

--a fan who happens to be a Harry Potter geek
Awww... <3 Somehow, I really love this expression. I've never seen "Patronus memory" used outside the canon (the Potterverse, I mean). It's really cool :)
Yes it is, thanks for helping NM be blue!
WE DID IT!!!
The nightmare of the past eight years draws to a close!

And your state even went for Obama, George!
Thankfully I can say the same about my state, too. For the first time in a long time, I'm truly proud to say the words, "I am an American."
Plus, I think we all know who Ned Stark would have voted for^^;;

Come on, Ned Stark would vote for McCain!

;-)

Yay. Instead of an old, white liar-in-chief in the pocket of corporations who doesn't like minorities, we get a young, black liar-in-chief all for killing babies. Let's throw a party.

wooooooooooooooooooooooooo

comments.upictitle: the Antisocial Little Ice Queen: SP: You have the weapons.
comments.article:
I dunno, man, we could use a thrilling round of "We Are the Champions".

Also on a semi-related note, I would just like to thank you, GRRM. So frequently when I find out about the personal lives of my favorite authors, I am utterly disenchanted with them and no longer able to read their work because I find out they're sexist, bigots, or just plain crazy. But reading your blog has just made me adore you all the more. So, thanks man. For not just being a good author, but also an all-round cool guy.
I concur.

Oh I'm so glad that you people elected Obama. I sincerely believe that these times are history in the making, history which will profoundly alter our social, economic and political system. With the two main economic and social systems of our era having failed (communism and capitalism), it is time for a new system, or no system at all. And such change demands a leader who will make the choice. I am not sure that Obama has the magnitute to rise to the circumstances, and how much willpower he has to make a stand against all those denying change, but I will show trust for one last time. I just honestly hope that he will survive long enough to build the foundations of a new world.
Where are you? What's the mood like where you are?

Is it real?
Did it really happen?
I need to sleep on it.

Nice use of the Mitch Miller, by the way...
comments.subject: Still soaking it in...

comments.article: Congratulations USA!!!

(Thanks for opening up the blog to comments this time. Share the joy!)

My favorite Obama line: We are the change that we have been waiting for.

Time to start fixing the screw-ups of the immature, ideological idiots that have really messed up our country over the past eight years.
Damn straight. Time to recover.
Hugs, hugs, hugs!  I'm over the moon, delighted, elated, puffed with pride and my heart's dancing a jig!  Our voters did the right thing!

Damn it, you've got me crying with joy again! I'm too exhausted from the fear and now the relief.

And thank you, New Mexico, for not embarrassing me!

we get to hold our candidates feet to the fire!
comments.subject: you just keep right on being wary.

comments.article: That video is so cheesy as to actually make it out the other side to amusingly cool.

I am still speechless.  I kept watching the polls, and thinking that Obama was going to win, but after 2000, I knew better than to count chickens.  This restored my faith in America! The fearmongers, warmongers, misled evangelicals and corporate crooks in charge have finally been displaced. To borrow a line from the "Jericho" finale:  "How does it feel to make history?"  I'd say it feels pretty damn good right now!
comments.subject: Yes We Can...and YES WE DID!

comments.article:
I couldn't justify staying up all night for the returns, so I woke up and immediately flipped on the TV to the BBC.

Grinning like a loon at the moment. It's a good day.
